comment: 上課教室在雲和街大樓二樓，地址為雲和街1號(位於雲和小火鍋斜對面、Cafe a la mode正對面)，從師大側門右轉看見Starbucks右轉進入巷子步行約2分鐘(130公尺)，右手邊就會看到雲和街大樓，亦可使用Google Maps APP查詢位置。請同學使用學生證感應，進出雲和街上課教室。
description: Course Objective: On completion of this course, participants will have: 	developed a critical awareness and understanding of the relevance of second language acquisition theories to the practice of second language teaching and learning.  Transferable skills: 	the ability to make a critical analysis and assessment of relevant theory, empirical studies and practical applications; 	the ability and knowledge required in order to engage in independent reflection and enquiry; 	greater confidence and proficiency in oral and written communication 	the ability to engage in creative thinking  Learning activities: Interactive lectures, whole-class discussion of topics, hands-on tasks, group- and pair-based discussion and problem solving, demonstrations, student-led presentations based on key readings, independent reading, library research.  Participants will be expected to contribute actively to the sessions.  Learning outcomes: In general, participants will be expected to: 	have an understanding of the theoretical rationales and principles behind different theories of SLA; 	be able to critically appraise, adapt and implement different theoretical SLA frameworks to suit their own teaching/learning contexts; 	be able to identify areas for personal research and development
goals: To developed a critical awareness and understanding of the relevance of second language acquisition theories to the practice of second language teaching and learning
syllabus:
**I.**   **Goal:**

The ultimate goal of this course is to discuss with students some important issues in Foreign Language Acquisition. By the end of the term, students are supposed to provide empirical findings to support what they learn in class.

**II. Requirements:**

1.  There are several quizzes for this class.

2.  A term paper is due on the last day of the class.

3.  Oral presentations and class participation are mandatory.

4.  Grading Policy:

     Quizzes --------------------------------------------------------------------  20%

     Paper  ---------------------------------------------------------------------   50%

    Oral Presentations --------------------------------------------------------   30%
